Key Match Events: France reached the quarter-finals of Euro 2024 after edging past Belgium in a scrappy and tight contest in Dusseldorf.
Jules Kounde gave the ball to N’Golo Kante, Kante slipped Randal Kolo Muani into the box, Kolo Muani’s shot hit Jan Vertonghen, the ball deflected past Koen Casteels and crossed the line.
Romelu Lukaku spun into the 18-yard area and forced a save from Mike Maignan at the near post.
Kevin De Bruyne came close with a blazing effort from range only for Maignan to keep him out.
Theo Hernandez made a notable tackle on Yannick Carrasco.
Randal Kolo Muani released a shot at the end of a fluent passing move that took a healthy piece of Vertonghen’s knee to beat Koen Casteels in the Belgian goal.
Post-Match Reflections: Roy Keane reacted to Belgium’s Euro 2024 exit, stating, 'It’s tough on them. I think France were the better team. Obviously, the quality wasn’t really there. It wasn’t a surprise that it was an own goal that settled the game. You also need a bit of luck. France kept a clean sheet and when you do that, you will always have a chance.'
